item.title: Help with loading sprites on client
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

you have a few things wrong with the beginning…it would be

else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("STATICON") && i = 4) { { try { Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Sprites/SKILLICON 4.jag"); anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441]; PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440); pixelgrabber.grabPixels(); System.out.println("Sprite: "+s+" "+i+" loaded."); } catch (Exception exception) { System.out.println(((Object) (exception))); } } something like that…

item.title: Help with loading sprites on client
item.dc:creator: @th3h1tm4n th3h1tm4n
item.description:
@th3h1tm4n wrote:

Hello, im ryan and im making my own client and after i will make a server for it. I have added custom items so far but now i want to customise the look of the client. It already has all the ‘new’(ish) gameframe but since jagex released the new skill icons i want to add those aswell. I dont know how to add these, but i have all of the sprites on my pc. Can anyone tell me or help me with code to load the skill icons in the write places? ive tried class_2_1_1 but nothing loads after i type in

else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("SKILLICON 4")) { try { Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Sprites/SKILLICON 4.jag"); anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441]; PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440); pixelgrabber.grabPixels(); System.out.println("Sprite: "+s+" "+i+" loaded."); } catch (Exception exception) { System.out.println(((Object) (exception))); } }

do i need to add anything else in other files? Btw im testing this out in a Clan_Chat_Client_471_Lunar_Edition and ive tryed it in my own client which is a highly edited E-Z Client V2 and both dont work

please post if you can help me or give me any advice on how to do it, rep for anyone who can help me.

thank you for your time

Ryan

Read full topic
